steps.summary: To learn a Back Double Cork 1080, first master a back cork 5, which involves snapping over your tail in a down throw motion. Then, combine the back cork 5 with an upward cab under flip.

steps.summary: To set up for a Back Double Cork 1080, use a "stacked takeoff" by throwing over your tail and fully extending, shifting your weight back. This will position you at a 450 degree rotation for the next part of the trick.

steps.summary: To prepare for a Back Double Cork 1080, master the "under flip a cab under flip," which is essentially a switch frontside cork 5.  This drill helps you learn the crucial shift from downward to upward rotation after spotting the knuckle on your approach.

steps.summary: To initiate the Back Double Cork 1080, fully extend and snap over the tail, then execute a "cab five" rotation, coming up and over your shoulder. This will set you up for the complex rotation needed for the trick.

steps.summary: To learn a Back Double Cork 1080, master cab cork variations with different flippy and flat approaches to get comfortable with various aerial positions. This will help you avoid being in an awkward position during the second flip of your double cork.

steps.summary: To prepare for a Back Double Cork 1080, master the Cab Cork 5. Your throw should be up and over your front shoulder, maintaining a tall chest with the throw angled backwards.

steps.summary: To learn the second half of a Back Double Cork 1080, start with a cab underflip, gradually increasing the rotation over your shoulder to make the trick more spinny. This builds the necessary motion for a smooth landing.

steps.summary: If you're learning Back Double Cork 1080, practice your Cab Cork 5's to perfect the flip-to-spin ratio. This will help you learn to go over your head two times, ensuring a stable landing.

steps.summary: To initiate a Back Double Cork 1080, flatten your initial takeoff trajectory more like a spin, instead of a straight down backflip. Then, pull over your shoulder, similar to a Cab underflip.

steps.summary: When throwing the Back Double Cork 1080, extend your body fully over your tail, initiating the throw more like a spin to achieve a smooth and consistent rotation. Avoid throwing the trick directly toward your toes.

steps.summary: After snapping and grabbing, rotate about 450 degrees, then pull your head up, tucking your chin into your shoulder to set up for the second flip and ensure a 1080 rotation. Avoid throwing your head straight back.

steps.summary: To achieve a smooth, controlled Back Double Cork 1080, focus on driving your chin towards your back arm and dipping your upper body into the rotation. This motion should feel similar to initiating a Cab Cork 5, helping you spot and manage the spin.

steps.summary: Focus on mastering the foundational tricks (Cab Cork, etc.) before attempting the Backside Double Cork 1080. Perfecting these prior steps will significantly increase your chances of landing the more complex trick.

steps.summary: To land a Back Double Cork 1080, find a great jump and maintain a smooth takeoff with a straight edge and tall upper body. As you spin, grab around 270 degrees, tuck your head into your shoulder to spot the landing, and pull into your spin.
